wikipedia_page.main: Griffith Williams (1769–1838) was a Welsh language poet. He chose Gutyn Peris as his Bardic name.

response: * Griffith Williams (1769–1838), a bardic pupil of Dafydd Ddu Eryri.
* February 2 – Griffith Williams (Gutyn Peris) (died 1838), Welsh poet
*16 October – Evan Pritchard (Ieuan Lleyn), David Thomas (Dafydd Ddu Eryri) and Griffith Williams (Gutyn Peris) are "ordained" bards of the province of Gwynedd by Iolo Morganwg.
* Griffith Williams (bishop) (c. 1589–1672), Anglican bishop of Ossory
* Sir Griffith Williams, 1st Baronet (died 1663), Sheriff of Carnarvonshire
* John Griffith Williams (born 1944), Welsh High Court judge
